text:
cos ω= ⟨x,y⟩
∥x∥∥y∥. (3.25)
The number ω is the angle between the vectors xand y. Intuitively , theangle
angle between two vectors tells us how similar their orientations are. For
example, using the dot product, the angle between xand y= 4x, i.e., y
is a scaled version of x, is 0: Their orientation is the same.
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
